meanings.definition: A soft, moist, and somewhat viscous substance, typically produced by mixing dry ingredients with a liquid.
meanings.sent1: I used paste to stick the paper together.
meanings.sent2: The paste was sticky and wet.
meanings.sent3: The paste looked like a blob of goo.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like paste, sticking in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The paste oozed slowly out of the tube.

meanings.definition: To stick or fasten (something) onto something else using paste.
meanings.sent1: She will paste the picture onto the wall.
meanings.sent2: I need to paste the label on the box.
meanings.sent3: He tried to paste the toy on the ceiling, but it fell down.
meanings.sent4: The memories paste themselves in my heart.
meanings.sent5: I paste the pieces together to create a beautiful picture.

meanings.definition: A thick, soft, moist substance, typically produced by mixing dry ingredients with a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The chef used paste to thicken the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The paste was smooth and creamy.
meanings.sent3: The paste felt like a cloud in my hands.
meanings.sent4: His lies were a paste covering the truth.
meanings.sent5: The paste added a rich flavor to the dish.
